metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23240 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.Description: selinux_edit_copy_tfiles in sudoedit in Sudo before 1.9.5 allows a localunprivileged user to gain file ownership and escalate privileges byreplacing a temporary file with a symlink to an arbitrary file target. Thisaffects SELinux RBAC support in permissive mode. Machines without SELinuxare not vulnerable.

criterions.comment: sudo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
